column4: Is there a way to increase the cpu utilization for a task on a dual core system?
I am hitting 130% max
I am at 130% now
I have a Core 2 Duo and top is saying I am running at 130%
Renicing does nothing
I would like to spill the task a little more into the second core
sounds like the second thread is just trying to do less than the first one.
then it is just a kernel issue then
just bumped itself up to 140%
possibly, or else the second thread depends on data produced by the first one, thus its speed will be capped by how fast the first thread can produce data
This is just doing the first pass to a file
this process use to take 3 hours
video encoding?
not it is only taking 80n minutes
yes
yes

AFAIK video encoders rarely if ever make full use of the second core because the second thread is simply not doing as much work as the first one. I may be wrong though - it's a while since I read up on it.
video encoding is quite a linear process
this is the test I am trying to see how long it will take for a render and animate for a 60 fps blander project
not to mention the encoding
hmm, I'd have thought the actual rendering process would make full use of both cores. Not sure though.
